result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David M Harris is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David M Harris was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 10/17/22 sent electronically to DCJ and DOC.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant David M Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for David M Harris.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM weapons enhancer on count 1. DISM ct 2. Time served. Argument. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # ct 2, weapons enhancer on count 1  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 17 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; TIME SERVED

-Days credit for time served: 13 (8/7/22 - 8/19/22)
-Days credit to jail: 13

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Becky K
